{"step_by_step_thinking": "The posterior superior alveolar nerve block is a type of local anesthesia used in dentistry. It is used to numb the upper back teeth on one side of the mouth. The needle is usually inserted in the mucobuccal fold above the second molar, and it passes through the buccinator muscle to reach the nerve. Therefore, the buccinator muscle is the one that is pierced during this procedure.", "answer_choice": "C. Buccinator"}
